$\textbf{(A) } 10 \qquad \textbf{(B) } 11 \qquad \textbf{(C) } 12 \qquad \textbf{(D) } 13 \qquad \textbf{(E) } 14$

ost_step.2: We want to write the probability that Team A wins the playoff as $\Pr[W_A] = \frac{1}{2}$.
ost_step.4:
We can simplify the above expression:

\begin{align*}
\frac{1}{2}&=(\tfrac{2}{3})(1-p)\left(1-\frac{2}{3}p\right)+\left(\tfrac{2}{3}\right)^2 p\\
\Rightarrow \quad \frac{2p^2-6p+3}{9}&=\frac{1}{2}\\
\Rightarrow \quad 2p^2-6p+3&=9\\
\Rightarrow \quad 2p^2-6p+0&=0\\
\Rightarrow \quad p&=\frac{3\pm\sqrt{(-6)^2-4(2)(0)}}{2(2)}\\
&=\frac{3\pm\sqrt{36}}{4}\\
&=\frac{3\pm 6}{4}\\
&=\frac{3}{4},\; 3/2\\
&=\boxed{\frac{3}{4}}
\end{align*}

The answer is E. So the answer is 7. Thus, $m+n=\boxed{14}.$
